DOC.brief_summary: Comparison of the effect of three times a week prophylaxis on all bleeds with on-demand treatment for children with severe Hemophilia A.
DOC.brief_title: Prophylaxis Versus on Demand Treatment for Children With Hemophilia A
DOC.criteria: Male, aged 216yrs Severe hemophilia A (<1% FVIII:C [Blood Clotting Factor VIII:C] ) Minimum of at least 50 documented ED (exposure day) prior to enrolment No measurable inhibitor activity at baseline and history of FVIII inhibitor antibody formation Parents or legal guardians document, sign, and date informed consent Another bleeding disease that is different from hemophilia A Known hypersensitivity to the active substance, mouse or hamster protein Thrombocytopenia (platelet count <100 000/mm3) based on previous medical records
